content.raw:
Ran a fresh build of the `./build.bash subt_shell` command to test in Docker this morning \(passing through the `--no-cache` flag to Docker to ensure everything is clean\). Entering the Docker container and running `ign launch -v 4 competition.launch robotName1:=X1 robotConfig:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4` I get errors about `ros1_ign_bridge` package being missing.

‌

Looking at the output of `dpkg-query -L ros1-ign-bridge`:

```
$ dpkg-query -L ros1-ign-bridge
/.
/usr
/usr/share
/usr/share/doc
/usr/share/doc/ros1-ign-bridge
/usr/share/doc/ros1-ign-bridge/changelog.Debian.gz
/usr/share/doc/ros1-ign-bridge/copyright
```

It seems that something is wrong with the latest debian package generated.

```
$ apt-cache policy ros1-ign-bridge
ros1-ign-bridge:
  Installed: 0.3.0-1~bionic
  Candidate: 0.3.0-1~bionic
  Version table:
 *** 0.3.0-1~bionic 500
        500 http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable bionic/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
```

Entering the Docker container and running ign launch -v 4 competition.launch robotName1:=X1 robotConfig:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_4 I get errors about ros1_ign_bridge package being missing.

‌

Looking at the output of dpkg-query -L ros1-ign-bridge:

        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
